verses.verse: Therefore my son, be strong in the grace that is in Christ Jesus
and what you heard from me--supported by many witnesses. Commit the same to trustworthy men who will be able to teach others also.
So then endure hardships as a good soldier of Jesus Christ.
No one on military duty involves himself in matters of livelihood, so that he may please him who enlisted him.
Also if one competes in a tournament, he isn't crowned the victor unless he competes according to the rules.
The farmer who works hard must be the first to eat from the harvest.
Think about what I am saying, and may the Lord give you understanding in everything.
Remember that Jesus Christ, the descendant of David, was raised from the dead according to my gospel.
For which I suffer hardships like an evildoer, even shackles, but the Word of God is not tied down.
Therefore I endure all this for the sake of the elect, so that they may also receive the salvation--which is in Christ Jesus--with eternal glory.
This is a true saying, "For if we are dead with him, we will also live with him.
"If we suffer with him, we will also reign with him. If we deny him, he will also deny us.
"If we are not faithful, he remains faithful; he cannot be untrue to himself."
Help them to remember these things, emphasize [to them]--in the sight of the Lord--not to argue about words, which is totally unprofitable except to bring devastation to the listeners.
Be earnest to present yourself approved by God, a workman who doesn't need to be ashamed, correctly handling the Word of Truth.
Stay away from irreverent and fruitless discussions, for they will increase into greater ungodliness,
and their words will eat away like gangrene; some of these are Hymenaeus and Philetus,
who--concerning the truth--have erred, saying that the resurrection has already come and cause the downfall of some people's faith.

Nevertheless the foundation [placed] by God stands sure having this official seal, "The Lord knows those who are his." And, "Let every one who identifies with the name of Christ depart from wrongdoing."
Now in a mansion there are not only vessels of gold and silver but also of wood and earth, some for honorable uses and some for dishonorable uses.
Therefore if anyone completely cleanses himself from these [dishonorable things], he will be a vessel for honor, made holy and useful for the master's use, and ready for every good work.
Flee the evil desires of youth, instead follow righteousness, faith, love, and peace with those who call upon the Lord out of purified heart.
Avoid foolish and stupid questions, knowing that they breed hostilities.
Also the Lord's servant must not get into angry arguments but be gentle to all, ready to teach, forbearing,
calmly explaining to those who are actively antagonistic, if perhaps God will give them repentance for acknowledging the truth,
and that they may return to sober thinking out of the devil's snare, who ensnares to do his will.
